hero.description: For small and medium businesses: we quickly design and launch a website, app, and bot that optimize work and increase productivity.

services.title: Full cycle of digital product development

items.title: Websites
items.desc: Corporate sites, landings and online stores with modern design and fast loading

items.title: Apps
items.desc: Mobile and web applications for iOS, Android and browsers with intuitive interface

items.title: Chatbots
items.desc: Smart bots for Telegram, WhatsApp and other platforms for communication automation

items.title: E-Agent
items.fullDescription:
E-Agent is not just an ordering tool. It is the operating system for a distribution business. It connects manufacturers, shops, warehouses, drivers, and accounting into a single managed loop. Its value lies not in a 'pretty interface', but in process control, elimination of manual chaos, and the ability to scale without losing control.

E-Agent turns scattered calls, chats, and tables into a transparent system: with clear stock balances, fixed personnel actions, flexible prices, and predictable logistics. It is a product for those who want to manage distribution as a system, rather than fighting operational fires every day.

challenges.p: Scattered communication between seller, manufacturer, warehouse, and driver
challenges.s: A unified workspace where all participants work in one loop: orders, invoices, statuses, action history.

challenges.p: Errors and losses due to manual ordering (WhatsApp, calls, Excel)
challenges.s: Standardized ordering in the app in a few clicks, without interpretations and the 'human factor'.

challenges.p: Lack of transparent inventory control
challenges.s: Online inventory tracking with synchronization between warehouse, drivers and shops.

challenges.p: Slow and error-prone warehouse receiving
challenges.s: Barcode scanning via camera, instant addition and verification of goods without manual search.

challenges.p: Drivers lose time, get confused with orders and customers
challenges.s: Dedicated driver interface: map, order list, customers, geo-search, inventory, debt calculator.

challenges.p: Lack of control over personnel actions
challenges.s: Activity log and role-based access model: visibility of who did what, with the ability to restrict specific functions.

challenges.p: Difficulty working with different customer types (private, shops, restaurants, wholesale)
challenges.s: Flexible pricing system allowing unlimited price categories for different consumer types.

challenges.p: Gap between operations and accounting
challenges.s: Integration with chatbots that automatically send orders and changes to accounting and warehouse channels.

challenges.p: Manual work with Excel and 1C, data duplication
challenges.s: Two-way integration with Excel and 1C: goods receiving, report export, invoice generation for drivers.

challenges.p: Lack of a scalable distribution system for the manufacturer
challenges.s: E-Agent as a distribution platform combining product, order, logistics, and settlement management in one tool.

items.title: Fabrico
items.fullDescription: An application for an atelier that brings order to orders. It creates a transparent interaction environment between the client and the master: clients can at any time see the status of their orders and participate in the loyalty program, while the owner gets full control over deadlines, the work queue, and detailed reporting in one place.

challenges.p: Chaos in order records and paperwork
challenges.s: A single digital database of all orders with fast searching and filtering.

challenges.p: Clients constantly call to find out the order status
challenges.s: Client's personal account, where the stage of product readiness is displayed in real time.

challenges.p: Difficulty in retaining clients and lack of marketing tools
challenges.s: Built-in loyalty program with a system of bonuses and personal offers.

challenges.p: Difficulties with controlling deadlines and masters' workload
challenges.s: Intelligent work queue management and automatic deadline notifications.

challenges.p: Lack of understanding of real profit and business efficiency
challenges.s: Analytics and reporting module, showing workload, revenue, and popular services in one click.

items.title: Questionnaire Portal
items.fullDescription: It is not just a survey app, but a tool for protecting data quality. It allows safely conducting online and offline research due to the 'one link - one answer' principle, excluding spam and distortion of results. Surveys are available via QR code without installing applications, results are recorded immediately and exported for analysis.

challenges.p: Online surveys are easy to spam and distort results
challenges.s: The 'one link - one answer' principle: each link leads to a unique sheet and cannot be used again.

challenges.p: Survey links are unsafe when forwarded to third parties
challenges.s: Isolated one-time questionnaires that do not scale and do not spoil the sample even if the link is leaked.

challenges.p: Difficult to conduct surveys offline (street, events)
challenges.s: On-the-fly QR code generation, allowing the survey to be taken without installing an application.

challenges.p: Inconvenient for the respondent - need to install or register something
challenges.s: Web survey via QR code, just a phone camera and a browser.

challenges.p: Interviewer is forced to stand nearby and wait for the survey to end
challenges.s: Result is recorded from the first click, even an incomplete survey gets into the database.

challenges.p: Last questions in the questionnaire are massively left without answers
challenges.s: Randomization of the order of questions, ensuring uniform completion of the entire questionnaire.

challenges.p: No flexibility in question types
challenges.s: Survey builder inside the application: answer options, open questions, different structures.

challenges.p: Difficult to track research progress in real time
challenges.s: Intermediate results right in the application, without waiting for the survey to end.

challenges.p: Manual data processing after collection
challenges.s: Export of answers to Excel for analysis, reports, and further processing.

challenges.p: No backup scenario if the respondent doesn't have a phone
challenges.s: Possibility of filling out the survey directly through the interviewer's application on site.

items.title: Kurochki Bot
items.fullDescription:
This is not just a Telegram bot for accepting orders, but a delivery operations management tool. It turns chaotic customer messages into a structured flow of orders, broken down by days, drivers, and routes. Its value is not in buttons and menus, but in predictability, planning, and reducing manual work.

The bot allows collecting orders in advance, automatically generating invoices, distributing them among delivery people, and building optimal routes without extra city driving. The driver receives a clear task checklist, and the business receives order history and data for analysis. This is a solution for those who want to manage delivery systematically, rather than collecting orders via chats and keeping everything in their head.

challenges.p: Orders come chaotically in chats and get lost
challenges.s: Structured order acceptance through the bot, all requests are collected in one format without manual correspondence.

challenges.p: Impossible to understand the volume of orders for the day in advance
challenges.s: Systematization of orders by day of the week with the possibility of accumulation and planning in advance.

challenges.p: Manual transfer of orders to delivery people
challenges.s: Automatic sending of orders to drivers at the right moment, without copying and forwarding.

challenges.p: Lack of a clear action plan for the delivery day
challenges.s: Built-in timer and delayed sending, allowing a work plan to be prepared in advance.

challenges.p: Errors when collecting orders for drivers
challenges.s: Automatic generation of invoices with a list of necessary goods for a specific delivery person.

challenges.p: Drivers waste time moving chaotically around the city
challenges.s: Route optimization by geolocations, orders are built in a logical sequence.

challenges.p: No control over order fulfillment by the driver
challenges.s: Built-in task completion checklist, each order is recorded as completed.

challenges.p: Impossible to analyze past orders and workload
challenges.s: Storage of order history for subsequent analysis and management decisions.

challenges.p: Difficult to make repeat sales and notifications to clients
challenges.s: Advertising and information mailing function to the client base.

challenges.p: Assortment flexibility is limited by manual administration
challenges.s: Flexible product settings and structures inside the bot, without constant improvements.

advantages.title: Five reasons to work with us

items.title: Fast development
items.desc: Launch MVP in 2-4 weeks. Agile approach allows us to adapt quickly to changes.

items.title: Transparent communication
items.desc: Daily updates, access to task tracker and direct contact with the development team.

items.title: Quality guarantee
items.desc: Testing at every stage, code review and 3 months of free support.

items.title: Expertise
items.desc: Over 100 successful projects. Deep understanding of various business industries.

items.title: Reliable team
items.desc: Close-knit team of senior specialists with experience in major projects.

items.title: Who we are for
items.desc:
• Small and medium businesses
• Startups at the MVP stage
• Companies that need to quickly launch and test a solution
• Those who want to automate processes, not just a "beautiful site"

items.title: Who we are not for
items.desc:
• Corporations with long tenders and complex bureaucracy
• Projects without a clear budget and deadlines
• Those who only need design "for the sake of form"

steps.title: Development

steps.title: Launch

steps.title: Support
steps.desc: Developing the product, adding new features and optimizing.
